channel.title: Text Processing on Dr. Erin Buchanan
channel.description: Recent content in Text Processing on Dr. Erin Buchanan

item.title: Gathering Text from the Web
item.author: buchananlab@gmail.com (aggieerin.com)
item.description: Hi everyone! I don’t really feel like working too hard today, so I decided to write a blog post about how my student Will and I used rvest to mine articles from several different news sources for a project. All the scripts and current ongoings of this project can be found on our OSF page - this project is also connected to the GitHub folder with the files. First, we picked four web sources to scrape - The New York Times, NPR, Fox News, and Breitbart because of their known political associations, and specifically, we focused on their political sections.

item.title: Working With Messy Text
item.author: buchananlab@gmail.com (aggieerin.com)
item.description: Heyo! I am doing my best to procrastinate here on a blustery Tuesday afternoon. So, I decided to share some code I’ve put together that solves problems in R that I used to do in perl. HTML or C++ was probably my first real language, but I love the heck out of perl. It’s never done me wrong (unlike you PHP). Anyways! The context of this project is that we are developing a dictionary of words to complement the work done by Jonathan Haidt and Jesse Graham - learn more.
